action.action-desc: Mrs. McMorris Rodgers introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To promote the use of blended learning in classrooms across America.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the 21st Century Classroom Innovation Act .

Except as otherwise expressly provided, whenever in this Act an amendment is expressed in terms of an amendment to a section or other provision, the reference shall be considered to be made to a section or other provision of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 ( 20 U.S.C. 6301 et seq. ).

section.header: Encouraging State and local blended learning projects

paragraph.text: In the case of a State that will carry out a program to award grants under section 2113(c)(3), a description of the program, which shall include—

subparagraph.text: the criteria the State will use to award grants under such section to eligible entities to carry out blended learning projects;
the State policies and procedures to be waived by the State, consistent with Federal law, for such eligible entities to carry out such projects, which may include waivers with respect to—

clause.text: restrictions on class sizes;
restrictions on licensing or credentialing of personnel supervising student work in such projects;
restrictions on the use of State funding for instructional materials for the purchase of digital instructional resources;
restrictions on advancing students based on demonstrated mastery of learning outcomes, rather than seat-time requirements; and
restrictions on secondary school students in the State enrolling in online coursework;

subparagraph.text: how the State will inform eligible entities of the availability of the waivers described in subparagraph (B); and
how the State will provide the non-Federal match required under subparagraph (D) of section 2113(c)(3).

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)(2), by striking 2.5 and inserting 1.5; and

subparagraph.text: by striking the matter preceding paragraph (1) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: The State educational agency for a State that receives a grant under section 2111 shall use the funds described in subsection (a)(3) to carry out one or more of the activities described in paragraph (2) or (3).

The State educational agency may use the funds described in subsection (a)(3) to carry out one or more of the following, which may be carried out through a grant or contract with a for-profit or nonprofit entity:

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (1) through (18) as subparagraphs (A) through (R), respectively;

clause.text: by redesignating subparagraph (A)(i) and clause (ii) as clause (i)(I) and subclause (II), respectively; and
by redesignating subparagraphs (B) and (C) as clauses (ii) and (iii), respectively;

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B), as so redesignated, by redesignating subparagraphs (A) and (B) as clauses (i) and (ii), respectively;
in subparagraph (D), as so redesignated, by redesignating subparagraphs (A) and (B) as clauses (i) and (ii), respectively;
in subparagraph (R), as so redesignated, by redesignating subparagraphs (A) and (B) as clauses (i) and (ii), respectively; and
by adding at the end the following:

The State educational agency may use the funds described in subsection (a)(3) to carry out a program to award grants on a competitive basis to eligible entities in the State to carry out blended learning projects described in this paragraph.

An eligible entity desiring to receive a grant under this paragraph shall submit an application to the State educational agency at such time and in such manner as the agency may require, and which describes—

clause.text: the blended learning project to be carried out by the eligible entity, including the design of the instructional model to be carried out by the eligible entity and how such eligible entity will use funds provided under this paragraph to carry out the project;
in the case of an eligible entity described in subclause (I) or (III) of subparagraph (E)(ii), the schools that will participate in the project;
how the eligible entity will ensure sufficient information technology is available to carry out the project;
how the eligible entity will ensure sufficient digital instructional resources are available to students participating in the project;
the ongoing professional development to be provided for teachers, school leaders, and other personnel carrying out the project;

as appropriate, how the eligible entity will use the blended learning project to improve instruction and access to the curriculum for diverse groups of students, including students with disabilities and students who are limited English proficient;
how the eligible entity will evaluate the project and publicly report the results of such evaluation; and
how the eligible entity will sustain the project beyond the grant period.

subparagraph.text: An eligible entity receiving a grant under this paragraph shall use such grant to carry out a blended learning project, which shall include at least one of the following activities:

clause.text: Planning activities, which may include development of new instructional models (including blended learning technology software and platforms), the purchase of digital instructional resources, initial professional development activities, and one-time information technology purchases, except that such expenditures may not include expenditures related to significant construction or renovation of facilities.
Ongoing professional development for teachers, school leaders, or other personnel involved in the project.

subparagraph.text: A State educational agency that carries out a grant program under this paragraph shall provide non-Federal matching funds equal to not less than 10 percent of the grant funds awarded by the State educational agency to eligible entities under this paragraph.

clause.text: The term blended learning project means a formal education program—

subclause.text: that includes an element of online learning, and instructional time in a supervised location away from home;
that includes an element of student control over time, place, path, or pace; and
the modalities along each student’s learning path within a course or subject are connected to provide an integrated learning experience.

clause.text: The term charter school has the meaning given the term in section 5210.
The term eligible entity means a—

subclause.text: consortium of the entities described in subclause (I) or (II), which may be in partnership with a for-profit or nonprofit entity.
